meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The elizaOS ecosystem shows significant technical refinement and infrastructure optimization alongside community challenges in token migration and Discord plugin functionality.

key_points.summary: Core technical improvements focusing on server optimization, reliability patterns, and user interface refinements indicate progress toward a production-ready elizaOS v2, though community-facing tools require immediate attention.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize the recently merged server optimizations against the user-facing Discord plugin functionality issues?
context: PR #6199 by @standujar titled 'refactor(server): optimization and reorganization' is merged
YogaFlame reported a TypeError ('this.runtime.hasElizaOS is not a function') when using the ElizaOS Discord plugin. Odilitime acknowledged responsibility for the change causing the issue.

answer_1.text: Focus developer resources on fixing user-facing Discord plugin issues immediately, as they directly impact our current community engagement.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizing user-visible issues may slow core v2 development but would improve current user satisfaction and demonstrate our commitment to community.

answer_2.text: Continue prioritizing server optimization and scalability improvements while assigning a smaller team to address the Discord plugin issues within the next week.
answer_2.implication: This balanced approach maintains progress toward production-ready v2 while addressing community needs, though it may lead to short-term user frustration.

answer_3.text: Integrate Discord plugin fixes into the broader v2 development roadmap without changing current priorities, communicating transparently to users about the timeline for fixes.
answer_3.implication: This approach maintains development velocity on v2 but risks user churn and negative community sentiment if issues persist too long.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: Given the recently merged PR addressing server reliability, what should be our next technical focus to support auto.fun's 24/7 agent activity?
context: PR #6199 by @standujar titled 'refactor(server): optimization and reorganization' is merged
Issue #6198 titled '[Server] Concurrent connection timeouts & add reliability patterns' by @linear is OPEN with no comments since its creation on December 1, 2025.

answer_1.text: Implement advanced monitoring and auto-scaling infrastructure to ensure 24/7 uptime for agents on auto.fun.
answer_1.implication: This would provide the technical foundation for reliable agent operations but requires significant infrastructure investment and expertise.

answer_2.text: Focus on parallel actions and background tasks capabilities to enhance agent performance and responsiveness during high traffic periods.
answer_2.implication: This approach improves the agent experience quality but doesn't address potential system-wide reliability issues.

answer_3.text: Prioritize the implementation of circuit breaker patterns and connection timeout improvements from issue #6198 to prevent cascade failures.
answer_3.implication: This directly addresses identified reliability concerns but may not be sufficient for the full range of auto.fun operational requirements.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we balance UI improvements like the markdown content spacing fixes with deeper technical work as we prepare elizaOS v2?
context: PR #6197 by @wtfsayo titled 'fix(client): improve markdown content spacing' is merged
PR #6159 titled 'fix: markdown spacing compact' is merged

answer_1.text: Establish a 70/30 split of resources with majority focused on core technical work and a dedicated smaller team maintaining UI polish.
answer_1.implication: This balanced approach ensures progress on v2 fundamentals while maintaining a polished user experience, though it divides team focus.

answer_2.text: Freeze UI improvements until v2 core infrastructure is complete to maximize development velocity on technical foundations.
answer_2.implication: This approach accelerates core v2 development but risks delivering a technically sound product with suboptimal user experience.

answer_3.text: Adopt a user-centric approach by prioritizing UI improvements that directly impact auto.fun adoption and visibility while maintaining core development.
answer_3.implication: This focus on user experience may attract more users to auto.fun in the short term but could delay critical infrastructure improvements.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Community discussions around AI agent monetization strategies, particularly in lead generation and brand-specific agents, present opportunities to diversify elizaOS revenue streams and drive growth for auto.fun.

deliberation_items.text: Which AI agent monetization model should we prioritize exploring for integration with auto.fun?
context: DorianD and Odilitime discussed potential revenue models for AI agents, particularly in high-value lead generation (cars, real estate, insurance) where companies like Edmunds.com earn $50-500 per lead.
Odilitime described a business model with 'an agent per brand' that can be deactivated when brands stop paying, managed by a 'head discovery agent' that refers users to appropriate brand agents.

answer_1.text: Prioritize lead generation for high-value purchases by developing specialized agents for real estate, automotive, and insurance verticals.
answer_1.implication: This model targets high-margin industries but requires domain expertise and enterprise partnerships which may be resource-intensive to develop.

answer_2.text: Focus on the 'agent per brand' model with a discovery layer, creating a marketplace for brands to deploy and maintain their own agents on auto.fun.
answer_2.implication: This approach creates a scalable platform model but would require significant investment in discovery mechanisms and brand onboarding systems.

answer_3.text: Develop AI marketing agents that can directly drive purchases through content creation, targeting influencers as early adopters and revenue generators.
answer_3.implication: This strategy leverages existing influencer ecosystems but may face competition from established content creation tools and requires sophisticated natural language capabilities.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we integrate enterprise AI adoption strategies into our elizaOS development roadmap?
context: DorianD shared the "Official Lean AI Company Playbook" on Substack, highlighting AI adoption in non-technical departments (accounting, customer experience, marketing).
DorianD noted that companies exceeding $3M ARR typically build custom workflow solutions.

answer_1.text: Create dedicated enterprise templates for accounting, customer experience, and marketing departments that showcase elizaOS capabilities.
answer_1.implication: This approach provides clear business value demonstrations but may divert resources from our core focus on auto.fun and 24/7 agent activities.

answer_2.text: Establish an enterprise partnership program with customization capabilities for larger companies while maintaining focus on auto.fun for community growth.
answer_2.implication: This dual approach balances revenue opportunities with community building but risks spreading resources too thin across different market segments.

answer_3.text: Focus exclusively on auto.fun user growth now, with plans to develop enterprise features after reaching critical mass of users and agents.
answer_3.implication: This consumer-first strategy maintains development focus but delays potential enterprise revenue streams that could fund further development.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Community members are experiencing token migration challenges and technical issues with elizaOS tools, requiring improved documentation, support processes, and communication to maintain momentum and engagement.

deliberation_items.text: What improvements to our token migration process should we implement to address current user challenges?
context: Multiple users reported difficulties with the token migration process, with moderators directing them to appropriate support channels.
When Namiko mentioned having a migration ticket closed without resolution, Odilitime suggested opening a new ticket.

answer_1.text: Implement a comprehensive migration dashboard showing eligibility status, progress, and troubleshooting steps for common issues.
answer_1.implication: This self-service approach reduces support ticket volume but requires significant development resources for a time-limited migration process.

answer_2.text: Establish a dedicated migration support team with improved ticket handling processes and clear SLAs for resolution timing.
answer_2.implication: This human-centered approach improves user satisfaction but increases operational costs and doesn't scale as efficiently.

answer_3.text: Create an AI assistant specifically focused on token migration issues that can handle common problems and escalate complex cases.
answer_3.implication: This solution aligns with our AI-focused mission and provides scalable support but may frustrate users with complex issues requiring human intervention.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How can we better leverage our technical expertise to improve community documentation and support processes?
context: Several blockchain developers introduced themselves in the coders channel, showcasing expertise in blockchain and AI development.
Create clearer documentation for the token migration process (Mentioned by multiple users including noahbenny007, Namiko, gaona6828)

answer_1.text: Implement a community contribution program for documentation, incentivizing newly introduced developers to improve and maintain guides.
answer_1.implication: This approach leverages community expertise but may result in inconsistent quality without proper oversight and standards.

answer_2.text: Create an automated documentation pipeline that syncs GitHub changes with user-facing guides to ensure technical documentation stays current.
answer_2.implication: This technical solution creates sustainable documentation processes but requires initial development investment and ongoing maintenance.

answer_3.text: Establish a dedicated documentation team with weekly review cycles and clear processes for incorporating community feedback.
answer_3.implication: This structured approach ensures quality but creates organizational overhead and potential bottlenecks in documentation updates.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
